slides.title: Welcome to GST Assessment
slides.content:
# GST Assessment & Appeals

Understand the **assessment** and **dispute resolution** process.

## What You Will Learn

- **Assessment** - Types and process
- **Audit** - Department audit
- **Demands** - Recovery procedures
- **Appeals** - Dispute resolution

## Topics

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Self-assessment | Returns |
| Scrutiny | Verification |
| Audit | Examination |
| Appeals | Resolution |

slides.title: Self-Assessment
slides.content:
# Return-Based Assessment

## Section 59

```
Every registered person shall:
- Self-assess tax payable
- Furnish return
- Pay tax
```

## Process

| Step | Action |
|------|--------|
| 1 | Determine liability |
| 2 | Claim ITC |
| 3 | Pay net tax |
| 4 | File return |

## Provisional Assessment

- When value uncertain
- Furnish bond
- Final assessment later

slides.title: Scrutiny of Returns
slides.content:
# Verification Process

## Section 61

```
Officer may scrutinize return:
- Verify correctness
- Issue notice if discrepancy
- Taxpayer explanation required
```

## Response Time

| Notice | Response |
|--------|----------|
| Discrepancy notice | 30 days |
| Explanation | Required |

## Outcome

| Result | Action |
|--------|--------|
| Accepted | Case closed |
| Not accepted | Proceedings |

slides.title: Department Audit
slides.content:
# Section 65

## Audit Process

```
1. Commissioner orders audit
2. 15 days notice
3. Audit at registered place
4. Must complete in 3 months
5. Extendable by 6 months
```

## Taxpayer Obligations

| Requirement | Action |
|-------------|--------|
| Records | Provide access |
| Documents | Make available |
| Information | Furnish |
| Assistance | Render |

## Audit Report

- Findings communicated
- 30 days response time

slides.title: Special Audit
slides.content:
# Section 66

## When Ordered

```
Commissioner may order if:
- Value not correctly declared
- Credit wrongly availed
- During scrutiny, investigation, or audit
```

## Auditor

| Appointed By | Qualification |
|--------------|---------------|
| Commissioner | CA or CMA |

## Timeline

| Stage | Period |
|-------|--------|
| Completion | 90 days |
| Extension | Further 90 days |
| Final report | To proper officer |

slides.title: Best Judgment Assessment
slides.content:
# Section 62 and 63

## Non-Filers (Section 62)

```
If return not filed:
- Notice issued
- 15 days time
- Best judgment assessment
- Additional tax + interest + penalty
```

## Unregistered Persons (Section 63)

```
Person liable but not registered:
- Assessment by proper officer
- Demand and recovery
- Registration may be granted
```

slides.title: Demand and Recovery
slides.content:
# Section 73 and 74

## Section 73 (Non-Fraud)

| Element | Requirement |
|---------|-------------|
| Time limit | 3 years |
| Interest | 18% |
| Penalty | 10% (if paid late) |

## Section 74 (Fraud)

| Element | Requirement |
|---------|-------------|
| Time limit | 5 years |
| Interest | 24% |
| Penalty | 100% |

## Show Cause Notice

```
3 months before above dates
```

slides.title: Interest and Penalty
slides.content:
# Additional Liabilities

## Interest

| Section | Rate |
|---------|------|
| 73 | 18% p.a. |
| 74 | 24% p.a. |
| Wrong ITC | 24% p.a. |

## Penalty Reduction

| Payment Timing | Penalty |
|----------------|--------|
| Within 30 days of SCN | Nil (Sec 73) |
| Within 30 days of SCN | 15% (Sec 74) |
| Within 30 days of order | 25% (Sec 73) |
| Within 30 days of order | 50% (Sec 74) |

slides.title: Appeals - First Level
slides.content:
# Appellate Authority

## Section 107

```
Appeal to Appellate Authority:
- Against order of adjudicating authority
- Within 3 months
- Extendable by 1 month
```

## Pre-Deposit

| Amount | Required |
|--------|----------|
| Admitted | Full |
| Disputed | 10% |
| Maximum | Rs 50 Cr |

## Procedure

- Appeal in FORM GST APL-01
- Grounds of appeal
- Supporting documents

slides.title: Appeal Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: First appeal must be filed within?

slides.title: Appeals - Tribunal
slides.content:
# Appellate Tribunal

## Section 112

```
Appeal against:
- Appellate Authority order
- Revisional Authority order
```

## Time Limit

| Appellant | Period |
|-----------|--------|
| Taxpayer | 3 months |
| Department | 6 months |

## Pre-Deposit

| Amount | Required |
|--------|----------|
| Admitted | Full |
| Additional | 20% |
| Maximum | Rs 100 Cr |

slides.title: High Court and Supreme Court
slides.content:
# Higher Appeals

## High Court (Section 117)

```
Appeal on question of law:
- From Tribunal order
- Within 180 days
```

## Supreme Court (Section 118)

```
Appeal from High Court:
- Substantial question of law
- Special leave petition
```

## Alternate Remedy

| Forum | Before Approaching |
|-------|-------------------|
| High Court | Exhaust GST forums |
| Writ | Exceptional cases |

slides.title: Advance Ruling
slides.content:
# Section 95-106

## Purpose

```
Clarity on GST treatment:
- Before transaction
- Binding ruling
- Applicant-specific
```

## Questions Covered

| Question | Covered |
|----------|--------|
| Classification | Yes |
| Rate | Yes |
| ITC eligibility | Yes |
| Place of supply | Yes |

## Authority

- Authority for Advance Ruling (AAR)
- Appeal to AAAR
